page.title: 01Kegworth, Sutton Bonington.
page.content: The{River Soar,}a tributary of the much larger{Trent}divides the area roughly into two halves. The eastern half centres on the village of{Sutton {Bonington}and the western half includes the much larger village of {Kegworth. Sutton Bonington}is a very long, thin village while{Kegworth though larger is more compact. Between the villages lies the{School of {Agriculture}with some 300 students. {Kegworth}centres on its large 15th. century church whilst{Sutton}contains two smaller churches as it was originally two villages. In the winter the{River Soar}floods the road between the two villages consequently flood walks have been erected. In recent years the development of the nearby {East Midlands Airport}has become a local issue for the residents of both villages.
